EventMapper.name: EventMapper
EventMapper.description:
EventMapper routes events to various event destinations
 based on custom logic.  The function signature is arbitrary.

params.name: mappingFunction
params.description:
function to determine where
 events are routed to.

VideoSurface.name: VideoSurface
VideoSurface.description:
Creates a famous surface containing video content. Currently adding
  controls and manipulating the video are not supported through the
  surface interface, but can be accomplished via standard JavaScript
  manipulation of the video DOM element.
  This extends the Surface class.

props.name: size
props.description: [width, height] in pixels

props.name: classes
props.description: CSS classes to set on inner content

props.name: properties
props.description: string dictionary of HTML attributes to set on target div

props.name: content
props.description: inner (HTML) content of surface

props.name: autoplay
props.description: autoplay

ViewSequence.name: ViewSequence
ViewSequence.description:
Helper object used to iterate through items sequentially. Used in
  views that deal with layout.  A ViewSequence object conceptually points
  to a node in a linked list.

props.name: index
props.description: starting index.

props.name: array
props.description: Array of elements to populate the ViewSequence
Optional backing store (internal

props.name: loop
props.description:
Whether to wrap when accessing elements just past the end
  (or beginning) of the sequence.

Context.name: Context
Context.description:
The top-level container for a Famous-renderable piece of the document.
  It is directly updated by the process-wide Engine object, and manages one
  render tree root, which can contain other renderables.

params.name: container
params.description: Element in which content will be inserted

ElementAllocator.name: ElementAllocator
ElementAllocator.description:
Internal helper object to Context that handles the process of
  creating and allocating DOM elements within a managed div.
  Private.

params.name: container
params.description: document element in which Famo.us content will be inserted

Engine.name: Engine
Engine.description:
The singleton object initiated upon process
  startup which manages all active Context instances, runs
  the render dispatch loop, and acts as a listener and dispatcher
  for events.  All methods are therefore static.

  On static initialization, window.requestAnimationFrame is called with
    the event loop function.

  Note: Any window in which Engine runs will prevent default
    scrolling behavior on the 'touchmove' event.

Entity.name: Entity
Entity.description:
A singleton that maintains a global registry of Surfaces.
  Private.

EventEmitter.name: EventEmitter
EventEmitter.description: EventEmitter represents a channel for events.

EventHandler.name: EventHandler
EventHandler.description:
EventHandler forwards received events to a set of provided callback functions.
It allows events to be captured, processed, and optionally piped through to other event handlers.

Group.name: Group
Group.description:
A Context designed to contain surfaces and set properties
  to be applied to all of them at once.
  This is primarily used for specific performance improvements in the rendering engine.
  Private.

Modifier.name: Modifier
Modifier.description:
A collection of visual changes to be
    applied to another renderable component. This collection includes a
    transform matrix, an opacity constant, a size, an origin specifier.
    Modifier objects can be added to any RenderNode or object
    capable of displaying renderables.  The Modifier's children and descendants
    are transformed by the amounts specified in the Modifier's properties.

props.name: transform
props.description: affine transformation matrix

props.name: origin
props.description: origin adjustment

props.name: size
props.description: size to apply to descendants

OptionsManager.name: OptionsManager
OptionsManager.description:
A collection of methods for setting options which can be extended
onto other classes.


**** WARNING ****
You can only pass through objects that will compile into valid JSON.

Valid options:
    Strings,
    Arrays,
    Objects,
    Numbers,
    Nested Objects,
    Nested Arrays.

  This excludes:
      Document Fragments,
      Functions

RenderNode.name: RenderNode
RenderNode.description:
A wrapper for inserting a renderable component (like a Modifer or
  Surface) into the render tree.

Scene.name: Scene
Scene.description:
Builds and renders a scene graph based on a declarative structure definition.
See the Scene examples in the examples distribution (http://github.com/Famous/examples.git).

params.name: definition
params.description: in the format of a render spec.

SpecParser.name: SpecParser
SpecParser.description:
This object translates the rendering instructions ("render specs")
   that renderable components generate into document update
   instructions ("update specs").  Private.

Surface.name: Surface
Surface.description:
A constraint that keeps a physics body on a given implicit surface
  regardless of other physical forces are applied to it.

props.name: size
props.description: [width, height] in pixels

props.name: classes
props.description: CSS classes to set on inner content

props.name: properties
props.description: string dictionary of HTML attributes to set on target div

props.name: content
props.description: inner (HTML) content of surface

Transform.name: Transform
Transform.description:
A high-performance static matrix math library used to calculate
  affine transforms on surfaces and other renderables.
  Famo.us uses 4x4 matrices corresponding directly to
  WebKit matrices (column-major order).

  The internal "type" of a Matrix is a 16-long float array in
  row-major order, with:
  elements [0],[1],[2],[4],[5],[6],[8],[9],[10] forming the 3x3
        transformation matrix;
  elements [12], [13], [14] corresponding to the t_x, t_y, t_z
         translation;
  elements [3], [7], [11] set to 0;
  element [15] set to 1.
  All methods are static.

View.name: View
View.description:
Useful for quickly creating elements within applications
  with large event systems.  Consists of a RenderNode paired with
  an input EventHandler and an output EventHandler.
  Meant to be extended by the developer.

EventArbiter.name: EventArbiter
EventArbiter.description:
A switch which wraps several event destinations and
 redirects received events to at most one of them.
 Setting the 'mode' of the object dictates which one
 of these destinations will receive events.

EventFilter.name: EventFilter
EventFilter.description:
EventFilter regulates the broadcasting of events based on
 a specified condition function of standard event type: function(type, data).

params.name: condition
params.description:
function to determine whether or not
   events are emitted.

GenericSync.name: GenericSync
GenericSync.description:
Combines multiple types of event handling (e.g. touch, trackpad
    scrolling) into one standardized interface for inclusion in
    widgets. TouchSync and ScrollSync are enabled by default.
    Emits 'start', 'update', and 'end' events as a union
    of the input sync providers.

params.name: options
params.description: default options overrides, passed to all sync classes

props.name: syncClasses
props.description:
array of classes in inputs/ which
  will feed input to GenericSync.

MouseSync.name: MouseSync
MouseSync.description:
Handles piped in mouse drag events. Outputs an object with two
  properties, position and velocity.
  Emits 'start', 'update' and 'end' events with DOM event passthroughs,
  with position, velocity, and a delta key.

PinchSync.name: PinchSync
PinchSync.description:
Handles piped in two-finger touch events to change position via pinching / expanding.
  Emits 'start', 'update' and 'end' events with
  position, velocity, touch ids, and distance between fingers.

RotateSync.name: RotateSync
RotateSync.description:
Handles piped in two-finger touch events to increase or decrease scale via pinching / expanding.
  Emits 'start', 'update' and 'end' events an object with position, velocity, touch ids, and angle.
  Useful for determining a rotation factor from initial two-finger touch.

ScaleSync.name: ScaleSync
ScaleSync.description:
Handles piped in two-finger touch events to increase or decrease scale via pinching / expanding.
  Emits 'start', 'update' and 'end' events an object with position, velocity, touch ids, distance, and scale factor.
  Useful for determining a scaling factor from initial two-finger touch.

ScrollSync.name: ScrollSync
ScrollSync.description:
Handles piped in mousewheel events.
  Emits 'start', 'update', and 'end' events with payloads including:
  delta: change since last position,
  position: accumulated deltas,
  velocity: speed of change in pixels per ms,
  slip: true (unused).

  Can be used as delegate of GenericSync.

props.name: direction
props.description:
Pay attention to x changes (ScrollSync.DIRECTION_X),
  y changes (ScrollSync.DIRECTION_Y) or both (undefined)

props.name: minimumEndSpeed
props.description: End speed calculation floors at this number, in pixels per ms

props.name: rails
props.description: whether to snap position calculations to nearest axis

props.name: scale
props.description: scale outputs in by scalar or pair of scalars

props.name: stallTime
props.description: reset time for velocity calculation in ms

TouchSync.name: TouchSync
TouchSync.description:
Handles piped in touch events. Emits 'start', 'update', and 'events'
  events with position, velocity, acceleration, and touch id.
  Useful for dealing with inputs on touch devices.

TouchTracker.name: TouchTracker
TouchTracker.description:
Helper to TouchSync  tracks piped in touch events, organizes touch
  events by ID, and emits track events back to TouchSync.
  Emits 'trackstart', 'trackmove', and 'trackend' events upstream.

params.name: selective
params.description: if false, save state for each touch.

TwoFingerSync.name: TwoFingerSync
TwoFingerSync.description:
Helper to PinchSync, RotateSync, and ScaleSync.  Generalized handling of
  two-finger touch events.
  This class is meant to be overridden and not used directly.

props.name: scale
props.description: scale velocity by this factor

Matrix.name: Matrix
Matrix.description: A library for using a 3x3 numerical matrix, represented as a two-level array.

Random.name: Random
Random.description: Very simple uniform random number generator library wrapping Math.random().

Draggable.name: Draggable
Draggable.description:
Makes added render nodes responsive to drag beahvior.
  Emits events 'dragstart', 'dragmove', 'dragend'.

props.name: snapX
props.description: grid width for snapping during drag

props.name: snapY
props.description: grid height for snapping during drag

props.name: xRange
props.description: maxmimum [negative, positive] x displacement from start of drag

props.name: yRange
props.description: maxmimum [negative, positive] y displacement from start of drag

props.name: scale
props.description: one pixel of input motion translates to this many pixels of output drag motion

props.name: projection
props.description:
User should set to Draggable._direction.x or
   Draggable._direction.y to constrain to one axis.

Fader.name: Fader
Fader.description: Modifier that allows you to fade the opacity of affected renderables in and out.

props.name: cull
props.description: Stops returning affected renderables up the tree when they're fully faded when true.

props.name: transition
props.description: The main transition for showing and hiding.

props.name: pulseInTransition
props.description:
Controls the transition to a pulsed state when the Fader instance's pulse
method is called.

props.name: pulseOutTransition
props.description:
the transition back from a pulsed state when the Fader instance's pulse
method is called.

ModifierChain.name: ModifierChain
ModifierChain.description:
A class to add and remove a chain of modifiers
  at a single point in the render tree

StateModifier.name: StateModifier
StateModifier.description:
A collection of visual changes to be
  applied to another renderable component, strongly coupled with the state that defines
  those changes. This collection includes a
  transform matrix, an opacity constant, a size, an origin specifier.
  StateModifier objects can be added to any RenderNode or object
  capable of displaying renderables.  The StateModifier's children and descendants
  are transformed by the amounts specified in the modifier's properties.

props.name: transform
props.description: affine transformation matrix

props.name: origin
props.description: origin adjustment

props.name: size
props.description: size to apply to descendants

Body.name: Body
Body.description:
A unit controlled by the physics engine which extends the zero-dimensional
Particle to include geometry. In addition to maintaining the state
of a Particle its state includes orientation, angular velocity
and angular momentum and responds to torque forces.

Circle.name: Circle
Circle.description:
Implements a rectangular geometry for an Body with
size = [width, height].

Particle.name: Particle
Particle.description:
A point body that is controlled by the Physics Engine. A particle has
  position and velocity states that are updated by the Physics Engine.
  Ultimately, a particle is a _special type of modifier, and can be added to
  the Famous render tree like any other modifier.

Collision.name: Collision
Collision.description: Allows for two circular bodies to collide and bounce off each other.

Constraint.name: Constraint
Constraint.description: Allows for two circular bodies to collide and bounce off each other.

Curve.name: Curve
Curve.description:
A constraint that keeps a physics body on a given implicit curve
  regardless of other physical forces are applied to it.

  A curve constraint is two surface constraints in disguise, as a curve is
  the intersection of two surfaces, and is essentially constrained to both

Distance.name: Distance
Distance.description:
A constraint that keeps a physics body a given distance away from a given
anchor, or another attached body.

Snap.name: Snap
Snap.description:
A spring constraint is like a spring force, except that it is always
  numerically stable (even for low periods), at the expense of introducing
  damping (even with dampingRatio set to 0).

  Use this if you need fast spring-like behavior, e.g., snapping

Wall.name: Wall
Wall.description:
A wall describes an infinite two-dimensional plane that physics bodies
  can collide with. To define a wall, you must give it a distance (from
  the center of the physics engine's origin, and a normal defining the plane
  of the wall.

  (wall)
    |
    | (normal)     (origin)
    | --->            *
    |
    |    (distance)
    ...................
          (100px)

    e.g., Wall({normal : [1,0,0], distance : 100})
    would be a wall 100 pixels to the left, whose normal points right

Walls.name: Walls
Walls.description:
Walls combines one or more Wall primitives and exposes a simple API to
interact with several walls at once. A common use case would be to set up
a bounding box for a physics body, that would collide with each side.

Drag.name: Drag
Drag.description:
Drag is a force that opposes velocity. Attach it to the physics engine
to slow down a physics body in motion.

Repulsion.name: Repulsion
Repulsion.description:
Repulsion is a force that repels (attracts) bodies away (towards)
  each other. A repulsion of negative strength is attractive.

RotationalDrag.name: RotationalDrag
RotationalDrag.description:
Rotational drag is a force that opposes angular velocity.
  Attach it to a physics body to slow down its rotation.

RotationalSpring.name: RotationalSpring
RotationalSpring.description:
A force that rotates a physics body back to target Euler angles.
Just as a spring translates a body to a particular X, Y, Z, location,
a rotational spring rotates a body to a particular X, Y, Z Euler angle.
    Note: there is no physical agent that does this in the "real world"

Spring.name: Spring
Spring.description:
A force that moves a physics body to a location with a spring motion.
  The body can be moved to another physics body, or an anchor point.

VectorField.name: VectorField
VectorField.description:
A force that moves a physics body to a location with a spring motion.
  The body can be moved to another physics body, or an anchor point.

SymplecticEuler.name: SymplecticEuler
SymplecticEuler.description:
Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) Integrator.
Manages updating a physics body's state over time.

 p = position, v = velocity, m = mass, f = force, dt = change in time

     v <- v + dt * f / m
     p <- p + dt * v

 q = orientation, w = angular velocity, L = angular momentum

     L <- L + dt * t
     q <- q + dt/2 * q * w

PhysicsEngine.name: PhysicsEngine
PhysicsEngine.description:
The Physics Engine is responsible for mediating Bodies and their
interaction with forces and constraints. The Physics Engine handles the
logic of adding and removing bodies, updating their state of the over
time.

CanvasSurface.name: CanvasSurface
CanvasSurface.description:
A surface containing an HTML5 Canvas element.
  This extends the Surface class.

props.name: canvasSize
props.description: [width, height] for document element

ContainerSurface.name: ContainerSurface
ContainerSurface.description:
ContainerSurface is an object designed to contain surfaces and
  set properties to be applied to all of them at once.
  This extends the Surface class.
  A container surface will enforce these properties on the
  surfaces it contains:

  size (clips contained surfaces to its own width and height);

  origin;

  its own opacity and transform, which will be automatically
  applied to  all Surfaces contained directly and indirectly.

params.name: options.classes
params.description: CSS classes to set on all inner content

params.name: options.properties
params.description: string dictionary of HTML attributes to set on target div

params.name: options.content
params.description: inner (HTML) content of surface (should not be used)

ImageSurface.name: ImageSurface
ImageSurface.description:
A surface containing image content.
  This extends the Surface class.

InputSurface.name: InputSurface
InputSurface.description:
A Famo.us surface in the form of an HTML input element.
  This extends the Surface class.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: placeholder text hint that describes the expected value of an <input> element

props.name: type
props.description: specifies the type of element to display (e.g. 'datetime', 'text', 'button', etc.)

props.name: value
props.description: value of text

CachedMap.name: CachedMap
CachedMap.description:
A simple in-memory object cache.  Used as a helper for Views with
provider functions.

MultipleTransition.name: MultipleTransition
MultipleTransition.description:
Transition meta-method to support transitioning multiple
  values with scalar-only methods.

SnapTransition.name: SnapTransition
SnapTransition.description:
SnapTransition is a method of transitioning between two values (numbers,
or arrays of numbers). It is similar to SpringTransition except
the transition can be much faster and always has a damping effect.

SpringTransition.name: SpringTransition
SpringTransition.description:
SpringTransition is a method of transitioning between two values (numbers,
or arrays of numbers) with a bounce. The transition will overshoot the target
state depending on the parameters of the transition.

Transitionable.name: Transitionable
Transitionable.description:
A state maintainer for a smooth transition between
   numerically-specified states. Example numeric states include floats or
   Transform objects.

An initial state is set with the constructor or set(startState). A
   corresponding end state and transition are set with set(endState,
   transition). Subsequent calls to set(endState, transition) begin at
   the last state. Calls to get(timestamp) provide the interpolated state
   along the way.

Note that there is no event loop here - calls to get() are the only way
   to find state projected to the current (or provided) time and are
   the only way to trigger callbacks. Usually this kind of object would
   be part of the render() path of a visible component.

TransitionableTransform.name: TransitionableTransform
TransitionableTransform.description:
A class for transitioning the state of a Transform by transitioning
its translate, scale, skew and rotate components independently.

TweenTransition.name: TweenTransition
TweenTransition.description:
A state maintainer for a smooth transition between
    numerically-specified states.  Example numeric states include floats or
    Transfornm objects.
   An initial state is set with the constructor or set(startValue). A
    corresponding end state and transition are set with set(endValue,
    transition). Subsequent calls to set(endValue, transition) begin at
    the last state. Calls to get(timestamp) provide the _interpolated state
    along the way.
  Note that there is no event loop here - calls to get() are the only way
    to find out state projected to the current (or provided) time and are
    the only way to trigger callbacks. Usually this kind of object would
    be part of the render() path of a visible component.

WallTransition.name: WallTransition
WallTransition.description:
WallTransition is a method of transitioning between two values (numbers,
  or arrays of numbers) with a bounce. Unlike a SpringTransition
  The transition will not overshoot the target, but bounce back against it.
  The behavior of the bounce is specified by the transition options.

KeyCodes.name: KeyCodes
KeyCodes.description: Collection to map keyboard codes in plain english

Timer.name: Timer
Timer.description:
An internal library to reproduce javascript time-based scheduling.
  Using standard javascript setTimeout methods can have a negative performance impact
  when combined with the Famous rendering process, so instead require Timer and call
  Timer.setTimeout, Timer.setInterval, etc.

Utility.name: Utility
Utility.description:
This namespace holds standalone functionality.
 Currently includes name mapping for transition curves,
 name mapping for origin pairs, and the after() function.

Deck.name: Deck
Deck.description:
A Sequential Layout that can be opened and closed with animations.

  Takes the same options as SequentialLayout
  as well as options for the open/close transition
  and the rotation you want your Deck instance to layout in.

props.name: transition
props.description: A transition object for changing between states.

props.name: direction
props.description: axis of expansion (Utility.Direction.X or .Y)

params.name: [options.transition={duration:
params.description:
500, curve: 'easeOutBounce'}
  The transition that executes upon opening or closing your deck instance.

params.name: stackRotation
params.description:
The amount of rotation applied to the propogation
  of the Deck instance's stack of renderables.

EdgeSwapper.name: EdgeSwapper
EdgeSwapper.description: Container which handles swapping renderables from the edge of its parent context.

params.name: options
params.description:
An object of configurable options.
  Takes the same options as RenderController.

Flipper.name: Flipper
Flipper.description:
Allows you to link two renderables as front and back sides that can be
 'flipped' back and forth along a chosen axis. Rendering optimizations are
 automatically handled.

props.name: transition
props.description: The transition executed when flipping your Flipper instance.

props.name: cull
props.description: If true, culls the 'hidden' side untill you flip to it.

GridLayout.name: GridLayout
GridLayout.description:
A layout which divides a context into several evenly-sized grid cells.
  If dimensions are provided, the grid is evenly subdivided with children
  cells representing their own context, otherwise the cellSize property is used to compute
  dimensions so that items of cellSize will fit.

props.name: transition
props.description: The transiton that controls the Gridlayout instance's reflow.

params.name: [options.dimensions=[1,
params.description:
1]] A two value array which specifies the amount of columns
and rows in your Gridlayout instance.

params.name: [options.cellSize=[250,
params.description:
250]]  A two-value array which specifies the width and height
of each cell in your Gridlayout instance.

HeaderFooterLayout.name: HeaderFooterLayout
HeaderFooterLayout.description:
A layout which will arrange three renderables into a header and footer area of defined size,
     and a content area of flexible size.

props.name: direction
props.description:
A direction of HeaderFooterLayout.DIRECTION_X
lays your HeaderFooterLayout instance horizontally, and a direction of HeaderFooterLayout.DIRECTION_Y
lays it out vertically.

props.name: headerSize
props.description:
The amount of pixels allocated to the header node
in the HeaderFooterLayout instance's direction.

props.name: footerSize
props.description:
The amount of pixels allocated to the footer node
in the HeaderFooterLayout instance's direction.

Lightbox.name: Lightbox
Lightbox.description:
Lightbox, using transitions, shows and hides different renderables. Lightbox can essentially be
thought of as RenderController with a stateful implementation and interface.

props.name: inTransform
props.description: The transform at the start of transitioning in a shown renderable.

props.name: outTransform
props.description: The transform at the end of transitioning out a renderable.

props.name: showTransform
props.description: The transform applied to your shown renderable in its state of equilibrium.

props.name: inOpacity
props.description:
A number between one and zero that defines the state of a shown renderables opacity upon initially
being transitioned in.

props.name: outOpacity
props.description:
A number between one and zero that defines the state of a shown renderables opacity upon being
fully transitioned out.

props.name: showOpacity
props.description:
A number between one and zero that defines the state of a shown renderables opacity
once succesfully transitioned in.

props.name: inOrigin
props.description:
A two value array of numbers between one and zero that defines the state of a shown renderables
origin upon intially being transitioned in.

props.name: outOrigin
props.description:
A two value array of numbers between one and zero that defines the state of a shown renderable
once fully hidden.

props.name: showOrigin
props.description:
A two value array of numbers between one and zero that defines the state of a shown renderables
origin upon succesfully being shown.

props.name: inTransition
props.description: The transition in charge of showing a renderable.

props.name: outTransition
props.description:
The transition in charge of removing your previous renderable when
you show a new one, or hiding your current renderable.

props.name: overlap
props.description:
When showing a new renderable, overlap determines if the
  out transition of the old one executes concurrently with the in transition of the new one,
 or synchronously beforehand.

RenderController.name: RenderController
RenderController.description: A dynamic view that can show or hide different renerables with transitions.

params.name: inTransition
params.description: The transition in charge of showing a renderable.

params.name: outTransition
params.description:
The transition in charge of removing your previous renderable when
you show a new one, or hiding your current renderable.

params.name: overlap
params.description:
When showing a new renderable, overlap determines if the
     out transition of the old one executes concurrently with the in transition of the new one,
      or synchronously beforehand.

ScrollContainer.name: ScrollContainer
ScrollContainer.description: SequentialLayout will lay out a collection of renderables sequentially in the specified direction.

props.name: surface
props.description: Options for the ScrollContainer instance's surface.

props.name: scrollview
props.description: Options for the ScrollContainer instance's scrollview.

Scroller.name: Scroller
Scroller.description:
Scroller lays out a collection of renderables, and will browse through them based on 
accesed position. Scroller also broadcasts an 'edgeHit' event, with a position property of the location of the edge,
when you've hit the 'edges' of it's renderable collection.

props.name: direction
props.description:
Using the direction helper found in the famous Utility
module, this option will lay out the Scroller instance's renderables either horizontally
(x) or vertically (y). Utility's direction is essentially either zero (X) or one (Y), so feel free
to just use integers as well.

params.name: clipSize
params.description: The size of the area (in pixels) that Scroller will display content in.

params.name: margin
params.description: The size of the area (in pixels) that Scroller will process renderables' associated calculations in.

Scrollview.name: Scrollview
Scrollview.description:
Scrollview will lay out a collection of renderables sequentially in the specified direction, and will
allow you to scroll through them with mousewheel or touch events.

props.name: direction
props.description:
Using the direction helper found in the famous Utility
module, this option will lay out the Scrollview instance's renderables either horizontally
(x) or vertically (y). Utility's direction is essentially either zero (X) or one (Y), so feel free
to just use integers as well.

props.name: rails
props.description: When true, Scrollview's genericSync will only process input in it's primary access.

params.name: clipSize
params.description: The size of the area (in pixels) that Scrollview will display content in.

params.name: margin
params.description: The size of the area (in pixels) that Scrollview will process renderables' associated calculations in.

params.name: friction
params.description:
Input resistance proportional to the velocity of the input.
Controls the feel of the Scrollview instance at low velocities.

params.name: drag
params.description:
Input resistance proportional to the square of the velocity of the input.
Affects Scrollview instance more prominently at high velocities.

params.name: edgeGrip
params.description: A coefficient for resistance against after-touch momentum.

params.name: egePeriod
params.description:
Sets the period on the spring that handles the physics associated
with hitting the end of a scrollview.

params.name: edgeDamp
params.description:
Sets the damping on the spring that handles the physics associated
with hitting the end of a scrollview.

params.name: paginated
params.description:
A paginated scrollview will scroll through items discretely
rather than continously.

params.name: pagePeriod
params.description:
Sets the period on the spring that handles the physics associated
with pagination.

params.name: pageDamp
params.description:
Sets the damping on the spring that handles the physics associated
with pagination.

params.name: pageStopSpeed
params.description:
The threshold for determining the amount of velocity

will affect a default interior state and modify it as you bring renderables in and out. However, if you want to control
the transform, opacity, and origin state yourself, you may call certain methods (such as inTransformFrom) to obtain state from an outside source,
that may either be a function or a Famous transitionable. inTransformFrom sets the accessor for the state of
the transform used in transitioning in renderables.

classitems.description:
Allows you to overwrite the way Scroller lays out it's renderables. Scroller will
pass an offset into the function. By default the Scroller instance just translates each node
in it's direction by the passed-in offset.
Scroller will translate each renderable down
